fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51132].

The calendar text is quite fine, and can be difficult to read, and is exacerbated by TEAMCAL-172.
Please allow one of two things:

OR
* Create a few pre-defined sizes (Small, Normal, Large)

fields.description:
This is separate from TEAMCAL-258.

The request is to have the time input selectable between AM-PM and 24h format.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51124].
  {panel}

*Support pain point!* Documentation is not obvious/clear for users of Team Calendars coming from old calendars on how to create/add calendars. 

Under https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEAMCAL/Using+Team+Calendars#UsingTeamCalendars-AddingtotheCalendar there are 3 links that are not clearly identified on being the instructions for creating a calendar, while it says add calendar, this is not the same as in the original calendars and can be confusing for users. Support answers the same questions every week explaining the difference in the new TC. Customers typically go to a page and try to Insert Macro > Team Calendar and then try to create the calendar on the fly on that specific page. Then when support directs the customer to the documentation mentioned above, customers still don't get it.

I would recommend adding an informative message to the box to insert macro > team calendar with something like:

(i) If you have not yet created the calendar you are trying to add to this page, navigate to User Menu > Calendar > Add Calendar and create the calendar first. You can then insert a macro on this page referencing the target calendar. 

While some customers understand the new process, I would say at least 5-10 tickets a week are created to address this or the question is asked in conjunction with an existing support request. It is time consuming to explain the same thing over and over and I don't believe our documentation does a good job explaining how to create a calendar. 'Adding a Calendar' should be one of the first sections in the docs since this would be the first thing users do when using TC for the first time.
fields.summary: Need more intuitive calendar creation process
User should be able to click on the field text to select a field to show
Ability to restrict the calendar to a fixed date range
Weekly/daily summary email should show links to related pages if there is

fields.description: Since dashboard list of events can easily stack up, it would be useful if the user could click on [x] button on every event, which would make that exact event disappear from the dashboard. The user would still be able to see the event if he opened the calendar.

fields.description:
If you hide a calendar the text goes grey - which is good. The only problem is the colour behind the dropdown triangle remains until you mouse out. it should instantly go white background (to show that it is hidden). Hovering over it again should change to the calendar colour (which it does).

The reason I think it should go white (until you mouse over again) is that it isn't that clear form the gray text that it's hidden. I was confused and didn't think it worked until I moved my mouse away. 

See attached video
fields.summary: Hiding a calendar from my list should also change the colour of the triangle background to white

fields.description:
Currently the monthly view, weekly view, and event add/edit screens show weeks always starting on Monday. As a new user, I've made too many mistakes to count because as a US citizen, I expect to see a week's display starting with Sunday.

The plugin should be configurable to specify what on which day the week begins.
fields.summary: Week start date should be selectable
Allow Team Calendar events to be entered in 12 hour time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51101].
  {panel}

On our site's dashboard I have a calendar macro defined as:

{code}{calendar:id=8f564b4b-afed-4ceb-b206-2e426f595648,a80c628d-5155-40bc-8a55-0874fb77bf71}{code}

The result is something that looks like this:
!User with View Rights.JPEG!

After using the new features from TEAMCAL-102 to restrict view access of one of those calendars, users who don't have view rights to that calendar now see a huge warning on our site:
!User without View Rights.JPEG!

I believe the appropriate user experience would be to see no errors and no indication that there is a calendar that they do not have access to.  I understand this has to be balanced with the requirement for editors to know if they fat-finger a calendar id in their macros when editing, and the error is probably useful then.  But big red boxes on dashboards are worse.

Marking as critical because I believe this is a significant bug that will impact many users as they begin to utilize the new features from TEAMCAL-102.
fields.summary: Better error message when viewing an embedded calendar as an unprivileged user

fields.description: For a long time I've wanted a calendar view in Confluence that looks like the [SIMILE Widgets Timeline Widget], it's a nice clean view. This view in confluence would be extremely useful for showing upcoming events or any date based data.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51093].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
* add User A to an event in a people calendar: User A will get a nice notification saying "you've been added to this event"
* edit the event and change the person to User B: User A will get a standard "this event has changed" notification

It would be nice if User A received a special "[user] has removed from from this event" notification.

fields.description:
Team Calendars is missing the ability to subscribe to individual events. I imagine a scenario where I set up a meeting, invite 8 people to it and they can then signify their intention to attend or not. Perhaps even with the ability for the event creator (or some other permission level, think secretary/minutes taker here) to show who actually attended the meeting.
Permissions to allow uninvited people to invite themselves would also be a good part of this.
fields.summary: Add event subscription, invite, RSVP or similar system.

fields.description:

  {panel}

Currently JIRA issues with mapped date / time fields are entered into the JIRA calendar with the following title

<issue key> - <issue summary>

If the issue has more than one mapped date / time field - the entry will appear twice and it will not be clear what each entry means.

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is an improvement, bug, or what...

It seems that when you create a calendar, you're the only person that can edit it. In the short term this is problematic for me; in TEAMCAL-119 I asked how to reassign calendars to other owners (officially or unofficially) so that at least I can have the right people responsible for the manually-imported-from-the-old-calendar-plugin calendars able to edit them.

However, there are two very distinct differences from the old system that are really going to be problematic:

1) Having multiple users able to edit a calendar. Previously if you could edit a page, you could edit the calendar. We really need to be able to emulate this behavior.
2) Having the ability to restrict calendar viewing/editing to a subset of people. Previously if you couldn't get access to a page, you couldn't see the calendar. We also really need to be able to emulate this behavior.

To me these are very critical security issues, because the upgrade path (3.5 doesn't support the old plugin, migrate to this one) doesn't mention that these controls are now lacking, and as a result we now have to either have some of our calendars be unusable until such a time as these controls are back or we have to make public some calendars that we don't really want public.
fields.summary: Access Control/Authorized User support
I'd like to allocate a colours to various people in groups : so I can manage payment runs at a glance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51043].
  {panel}

It could be helpful to customers if the end time for an appointment automatically changed by X amount of time if a customer changed the start time.

For example, consider this test appointment:

8/16, from 8:00 to 9:00

If a customer changes the appointment start time to this:

8/17, starting at 10:00

Then TeamCalendars would automatically update the end time to this:

8/17, ending at 11:00


Thanks for considering it!
fields.summary: Automatically adjust the event end time if the start time is modified
When choosing a page for the event, it should display the space
Add ability to undo a change to an event
Confluence global language setting should set language default for all users
People calendar should show event description in month and week views in the iCalendar subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51035].
  {panel}

Team Calendars will always have limited "Advanced" editing possibilities, but luckily we can export and import (using ics files).

However there seems not to exist a 'remove all events' feature. This is needed if one performed major updates (i.e. replaced a single word in all events)

As a result one needs to remove the whole calendar and add the import the updated ics file to a new calendar. This has several unwanted side affects:
* breaks all existing user subscriptions / configurations (like color selection)
* breaks all watches
* on deletion an ics file is sent to all subscribers. They don't understand why this is and it's obviously not interesting to them.

To complete the circle an email could be sent to the watchers that this calendar is re-imported (I don't think it'll be a requirement to know the exact differences)
fields.summary: Allow Remove all items (maybe just on import?)
Calendar legend should appear to the side of calendars, not below them

fields.description:
Rename subscribe dialog from "Welcome to Confluence Team Calendars" to just "Welcome to Team Calendars" - going to use Team Calendars as the name.

Minor can fix in 1.x

GreenHopper sprint dates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51027].
  {panel}

At the moment, the Team Calendars starting day of the week is configured by the users locale. We've run into a few problems with this:

1. There isn't a simple way for admins to change the locale for everyone (CONF-16057, TEAMCAL-318)
2. Some customers don't necessarily want it to respect the locale TEAMCAL-466.

This issue is to look at solving this problem. Proposed solution:

1. Global setting for "start day of the week" (defaults to whatever the locale is)
2. This can be overridden by a user setting for start day of the week.


!image_2012-8-9_20-24-12.png!
fields.summary: Ability for admins to override the start day of the week
